tddt.tracker

Class Tracker

  • java.lang.Object
    • tddt.tracker.Tracker

  • public class Tracker
extends java.lang.Object
    This class tracks the coding behavior of the user. It saves what the user changes and when.
    Version:
    unknown
    Author:
    Jule Pohlmann, Caro Jachmann

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Tracker(java.lang.String code, java.lang.String test)
      The constructor initializes the variables and erases all former information off the file the analyse is saved to.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tracker

        public Tracker(java.lang.String code,
               java.lang.String test)
        The constructor initializes the variables and erases all former information off the file the analyse is saved to.
        Parameters:
        code - The initial code which is going to be changed by the user.
        test - The initial test code which is going to be changed by the user.

    • Method Detail

      • callDump

        public void callDump(java.lang.String now,
                     int phase,
                     boolean back)

        If back is true this method adds a String to the tracker output file. Otherwise it calls dump(String, int)

        Parameters:
        now - The current state of the code.
        phase - The current phase the user is in.
        back - This parameter is true if the user went back into a previous phase.
        See Also:
        dump(String, int)

      • showOutput

        public void showOutput()
        Prints the content of the tracking log into a new Stage.

      • output

        private java.lang.String output()
        Reads the content of the tracking log file into a String
        Returns:
        String that contains the tracking log.

      • dump

        public java.lang.String dump(java.lang.String now,
                             int phase)
        Saves the difference between the initial and the current code using the getDiff(String, int) method and changes the initial code to the current code. It then returns the saved difference as a String.
        Parameters:
        now - The current code / test
        phase - phase: 0 = RED, 1 = GREEN, 2 = REFACTOR
        Returns:
        A String that contains all the changes that've been done to the initial code.

      • writeToFile

        private void writeToFile(java.lang.String output)
        Writes a String to a file.
        Parameters:
        output - The String that is to be saved to the file.

      • getDiff

        private java.lang.String getDiff(java.lang.String now,
                                 int phase)
        Gets the difference between the current code and the initial code.
        Parameters:
        now - The current code.
        phase - The current phase the user is in.
        Returns:
        A String that contains all differences between the current and the initial code.

      • getLines

        private static java.lang.String[] getLines(java.lang.String a)
        Splits a String at every newline character and saves the fragments to a String array.
        Parameters:
        a - The String that is going to be split.
        Returns:
        The String Array that contains the fragments.
